Detailed Description

Interface used to allow the creator of a dialog to run some code when an item on the dialog is clicked.

The following example demonstrates how to use the IDialogOnClickListener. 

  //You need implement your owner OnClick Listener for Dialog
  class MyDialogOnClickListener : gaia::core::IDialogOnClickListener {
    public:
      MyDialogOnClickListener();
      virtual ~MyDialogOnClickListener();
      void onClick(int which_button);
  };

  void MyDialogOnClickListener::onClick(int which_button) {
      switch (which_button) {
          case gaia::core::AlertBox::BUTTON_POSITIVE:
              //Indicate the Button position of left is clicked.
              //Positive button is clicked!!
              . . .
              break;
          case gaia::core::AlertBox::BUTTON_NEUTRAL:
              //Indicate the Button position of center is clicked.
              //"Neutral button is clicked!!"
              . . .
              break;
          case gaia::core::AlertBox::BUTTON_NEGATIVE:
              //Indicate the Button position of right is clicked.
              //"Negative button is clicked!!"
              . . .
              break;
          Default:
              //"Unknown button is clicked!!"
              break;
      }
  }

  //When you want to enable alertbox button, just pass the listener
  gaia::core::AlertBox* dialog = new gaia::core::AlertBox(page);
  MyDialogOnClickListener* listener = new MyDialogOnClickListener();
  if (listener == NULL) {
      // DialogOnClickListener create failure!!
      return;
  }

  if (dialog != NULL) {
    . . .
    dialog->enableButton(gaia::core::AlertBox::BUTTON_POSITIVE, gaia::base::String("OK"), listener);
    dialog->enableButton(gaia::core::AlertBox::BUTTON_NEGATIVE, gaia::base::String("No"), listener);
    dialog->enableButton(gaia::core::AlertBox::BUTTON_NEUTRAL,  gaia::base::String("Bye!!"), listener);
  }

virtual void gaia::ui::IDialogOnClickListener::onClick ( int32_t  which_button) [pure virtual]

This method will be invoked when a button in the dialog is clicked.

Parameters:
which_buttonThe specified button was clicked (e.g. AlertBox::BUTTON_POSITIVE)
